newsitem.title: USA: North American bunkers mixed, West Coast up.
newsitem.headline: North American bunkers mixed, West Coast up.

text.p: North American bunker prices were steady in the East Coast but up in the West Coast amid higher prices in the Far East, players said on Tuesday.
In the West Coast, demand kicked in in the Los Angeles hub, pulling 380 CST up to between $93 a tonne and $94 a tonne.
The demand leaked into Seattle, which was reported up $4 to $99/$100 for 380 CST. 180 CST was about $104/$105 a tonne.
"There is a lot of demand in the West Coast but I also think they are getting some help from higher prices in the Far East," said a U.S. trader.
